text: The men's shot put competition of the athletics events at the 1979 Pan American Games took place at the Estadio Sixto Escobar.Full results The defending Pan American Games champion was Bruce Pirnie of Canada. ==Records== Prior to this competition, the existing world and Pan American Games records were as follows: {| class="wikitable" |- |World record | |22.15 |Gothenburg, Sweden |July 6, 1978 |- |Pan American Games record | |19.83 |Winnipeg, Canada |1967 |} ==Results== All distances shown are in meters. {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%;position:relative;" width=68% |- |KEY: |align=center|WR||World Record |align=center|GR||Pan American Record |} ===Final=== {| class="wikitable sortable" |- !Rank !Name !Nationality !Distance !Notes |- | |Dave Laut | |20.22 |GR |- | |Bishop Dolegiewicz | |19.67 | |- | |Bruno Pauletto | |19.61 | |- | |Al Feuerbach | |18.86 | |- | |Luis Delís | |18.21 | |- | |Nicolás Hernández | |16.37 | |- | |Radai Mendoza | |16.17 | |- | |Bradley Cooper | |15.37 | |- | |Pedro Serrano | |15.30 | |- |10 |Gert Weil | |15.06 | |- | |José Carreño | | | |- | |Jesús Ramos | | | |} ==References== Category:Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games 1979
title: Athletics at the 1979 Pan American Games – Men's shot put
